soot.jimple.infoflow

Class PairingInfoflow

  • java.lang.Object
    • soot.jimple.infoflow.AbstractInfoflow
      • soot.jimple.infoflow.PairingInfoflow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IInfoflow

    public class PairingInfoflow
extends AbstractInfoflow
    main infoflow class which triggers the analysis and offers method to customize it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PairingInfoflow

        public PairingInfoflow()
        Creates a new instance of the InfoFlow class for analyzing plain Java code without any references to APKs or the Android SDK.

      • PairingInfoflow

        public PairingInfoflow(java.lang.String androidPath,
                       boolean forceAndroidJar)
        Creates a new instance of the Infoflow class for analyzing Android APK files.
        Parameters:
        androidPath - If forceAndroidJar is false, this is the base directory of the platform files in the Android SDK. If forceAndroidJar is true, this is the full path of a single android.jar file.
        forceAndroidJar - True if a single platform JAR file shall be forced, false if Soot shall pick the appropriate platform version

      • PairingInfoflow

        public PairingInfoflow(java.lang.String androidPath,
                       boolean forceAndroidJar,
                       BiDirICFGFactory icfgFactory,
                       IPathBuilderFactory pathBuilderFactory)
        Creates a new instance of the Infoflow class for analyzing Android APK files.
        Parameters:
        androidPath - If forceAndroidJar is false, this is the base directory of the platform files in the Android SDK. If forceAndroidJar is true, this is the full path of a single android.jar file.
        forceAndroidJar - True if a single platform JAR file shall be forced, false if Soot shall pick the appropriate platform version
        icfgFactory - The interprocedural CFG to be used by the InfoFlowProblem
        pathBuilderFactory - The factory class for constructing a path builder algorithm

    • Method Detail

      • setSootConfig

        public void setSootConfig(IInfoflowConfig config)

      • initializeSoot

        private void initializeSoot(java.lang.String appPath,
                            java.lang.String libPath,
                            java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> classes)
        Initializes Soot.
        Parameters:
        appPath - The application path containing the analysis client
        libPath - The Soot classpath containing the libraries
        classes - The set of classes that shall be checked for data flow analysis seeds. All sources in these classes are used as seeds.
        sourcesSinks - The manager object for identifying sources and sinks

      • initializeSoot

        private void initializeSoot(java.lang.String appPath,
                            java.lang.String libPath,
                            java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> classes,
                            java.lang.String extraSeed)
        Initializes Soot.
        Parameters:
        appPath - The application path containing the analysis client
        libPath - The Soot classpath containing the libraries
        classes - The set of classes that shall be checked for data flow analysis seeds. All sources in these classes are used as seeds. If a non-empty extra seed is given, this one is used too.

      • appendClasspath

        private java.lang.String appendClasspath(java.lang.String appPath,
                                         java.lang.String libPath)
        Appends two elements to build a classpath
        Parameters:
        appPath - The first entry of the classpath
        libPath - The second entry of the classpath
        Returns:
        The concatenated classpath

      • computeInfoflow

        public void computeInfoflow(java.lang.String appPath,
                            java.lang.String libPath,
                            IEntryPointCreator entryPointCreator,
                            ISourceSinkManager sourcesSinks)
        Description copied from interface: IInfoflow
        Computes the information flow on a list of entry point methods. This list is used to construct an artificial main method following the Android life cycle for all methods that are detected to be part of Android's application infrastructure (e.g. android.app.Activity.onCreate)
        Parameters:
        appPath - The path containing the client program's files
        libPath - the path to the main folder of the (unpacked) library class files
        entryPointCreator - the entry point creator to use for generating the dummy main method
        sourcesSinks - manager class for identifying sources and sinks in the source code

      • computeInfoflow

        public void computeInfoflow(java.lang.String appPath,
                            java.lang.String libPath,
                            java.lang.String entryPoint,
                            ISourceSinkManager sourcesSinks)
        Description copied from interface: IInfoflow
        Computes the information flow on a single method. This method is directly taken as the entry point into the program, even if it is an instance method.
        Parameters:
        appPath - The path containing the client program's files
        libPath - the path to the main folder of the (unpacked) library class files
        entryPoint - the main method to analyze
        sourcesSinks - manager class for identifying sources and sinks in the source code

      • runAnalysis

        protected void runAnalysis(ISourceSinkManager sourcesSinks)
        Conducts a taint analysis on an already initialized callgraph
        Parameters:
        sourcesSinks - The sources and sinks to be used

      • runAnalysis

        private void runAnalysis(ISourceSinkManager sourcesSinks,
                         java.util.Set<java.lang.String> additionalSeeds)
        Conducts a taint analysis on an already initialized callgraph
        Parameters:
        sourcesSinks - The sources and sinks to be used
        additionalSeeds - Additional seeds at which to create A ZERO fact even if they are not sources

        Parameters:

        Gets a list of all units that invoke other methods in the given method
        Parameters:
        method - The method from which to get all invocations
        Returns:
        The list of units calling other methods in the given method if there is at least one such unit. Otherwise null.

      • scanMethodForSourcesSinks

        private int scanMethodForSourcesSinks(ISourceSinkManager sourcesSinks,
                                      PairingInfoflowProblem forwardProblem,
                                      soot.SootMethod m,
                                      java.util.List<java.lang.String> ep_methods_for_requests,
                                      java.util.List<java.lang.String> ep_methods_for_responses)
        Scans the given method for sources and sinks contained in it. Sinks are just counted, sources are added to the InfoflowProblem as seeds.
        Parameters:
        sourcesSinks - The SourceSinkManager to be used for identifying sources and sinks
        forwardProblem - The InfoflowProblem in which to register the sources as seeds
        m - The method to scan for sources and sinks
        ep_methods_for_responses -
        ep_methods_for_requests -
        Returns:
        The number of sinks found in this method

      • getResults

        public InfoflowResults getResults()
        Description copied from interface: IInfoflow
        getResults returns the results found by the analysis
        Returns:
        the results

      • isResultAvailable

        public boolean isResultAvailable()
        Description copied from interface: IInfoflow
        A result is available if the analysis has finished - so if this method returns false the analysis has not finished yet or was not started (e.g. no sources or sinks found)
        Returns:
        boolean that states if a result is available

      • getAccessPathLength

        public static int getAccessPathLength()

      • setAccessPathLength

        public static void setAccessPathLength(int accessPathLength)
        Sets the maximum depth of the access paths. All paths will be truncated if they exceed the given size.
        Parameters:
        accessPathLength - the maximum value of an access path. If it gets longer than this value, it is truncated and all following fields are assumed as tainted (which is imprecise but gains performance) Default value is 5.

      • setPathAgnosticResults

        public static void setPathAgnosticResults(boolean pathAgnosticResults)
        Sets whether results (source-to-sink connections) that only differ in their propagation paths shall be merged into a single result or not.
        Parameters:
        pathAgnosticResults - True if two results shall be regarded as equal if they connect the same source and sink, even if their propagation paths differ, otherwise false

      • getPathAgnosticResults

        public static boolean getPathAgnosticResults()
        Gets whether results (source-to-sink connections) that only differ in their propagation paths shall be merged into a single result or not.
        Returns:
        True if two results shall be regarded as equal if they connect the same source and sink, even if their propagation paths differ, otherwise false

      • getUseRecursiveAccessPaths

        public static boolean getUseRecursiveAccessPaths()
        Gets whether recursive access paths shall be reduced, e.g. whether we shall propagate a.[next].data instead of a.next.next.data.
        Returns:
        True if recursive access paths shall be reduced, otherwise false

      • setUseRecursiveAccessPaths

        public static void setUseRecursiveAccessPaths(boolean useRecursiveAccessPaths)
        Sets whether recursive access paths shall be reduced, e.g. whether we shall propagate a.[next].data instead of a.next.next.data.
        Parameters:
        useRecursiveAccessPaths - True if recursive access paths shall be reduced, otherwise false

      • getOneResultPerAccessPath

        public static boolean getOneResultPerAccessPath()
        Gets whether different results shall be reported if they only differ in the access path the reached the sink or left the source
        Returns:
        True if results shall also be distinguished based on access paths

      • setOneResultPerAccessPath

        public static void setOneResultPerAccessPath(boolean oneResultPerAP)
        Gets whether different results shall be reported if they only differ in the access path the reached the sink or left the source
        Parameters:
        oneResultPerAP - True if results shall also be distinguished based on access paths
